query: Q1. What can you set a reminder for in Outlook?
options:
all of these answers
 contacts
 email messages
 appointments and meetings

query: Q2. What is the default permission that other people in your organization have to your calendar?
options:
They can view free/busy details only.
 They can edit.
 They can view all details.
 They can view titles and locations.

query: Q3. Your boss sends you an email with a request to set up a meeting and copies all meeting attendees on the message. What is the fastest way to create the calendar appointment
options:
Click New Items > New Appointment.
 Click Calendar > New Meeting, and then copy and paste information as needed.
 with the email open, click Meeting on the Home ribbon or Message tab.
 Click Reply All.

query: Q4. You are running low on Outlook storage space. How might you address this problem?
options:
all of these answers
 Archive messages you are done with.
 Save and then remove large attachments from messages
 Sort by size and then delete large messages.

query: Q6. What address box should you use if you want to hide message recipients from each other?
options:
Bcc
 to
 cc
 From

query: Q7. You are creating a new email message to Diane and Joey. You need a response from Diane, but are simply informing Joey. How should you address the email?
options:
to Diane and Joey
 to Diane and bcc Joey
 to Joey and bcc Diane
 to Diane and cc Joey

query: Q8. Which choice is not an attachment?
options:
a PDF document included with an email
 a Word document included with an email
 (Ã‚) a calendar item included with an email
 a hyperlink included in an email

query: Q9. You can use a**\_to indicate that a message requires further action and a**to organize the message.
options:
folder; category
 flag; tag
 category; flag
 flag; category

query: Q11. What does Outlook automatically point out to you when you are invited to a meeting?
options:
if your attendance is mandatory
 ifthe meeting is high or low priority
 the amount of time you have between this meeting and your next event
 if the meeting is adjacent to another event in your calendar

query: Q12. What appears on your screen whenever a new email arrives?
options:
an emoji
 an alert
 a notice
 a bell icon

query: Q14. Removing redundant messages can be completed by utilizing what Outlook features?
options:
Filter
 Junk Mail
 The Delete Key
 Clean Up Conversation

query: Q15. You have sent several emails to a customer and have not received a response. What option do you set to know whether the customer receives your messages?
options:
Delivery receipt
 All of these answers
 Read receipt
 Tracking

query: Q16. A message on your summary list appears with a paper clip icon and an arrow pointing to the left. What does this indicate?
options:
The message has been replied to and contains an attachment
 The message has been flagged and contains an attachment
 None of these answers
 The message has been forwarded and contains an attachment

query: Q19. There are two types of Outlook rules. One is server-based rules, which run for Exchange Server. What are the other kind, which in part or in whole cannot run on Exchange Server, and when do the execute?
options:
client-only rules; when Outlook is running
 Outlook-based rules; when Outlook is running
 None of these answers
 Outlook-only rules; when Outlook is offline

query: Q21. How can you quickly locate emails with large attachment?
options:
Sort the messages by size then filter by Has: Attachments
 Sort the messages by sender
 Sort the messages by Has: Attachments and then filter by Is: Large
 Sort the messages by Has: Attachments and then by size

query: Q22. What is not a built-in search filter for message folder?
options:
Has Attachments
 Sent to me as Bcc
 Categorized
 Not sent directly to me

query: Q23. You created a meeting for next Friday at 1 PM, and several invitees have accepted. How do you change only your version of the meeting to 12 PM to allow time to setup?
options:
Double click the meeting to open its form, and then change the start time and close it
 None of these answers
 Open the calendar in Day, Week, or Work Week view and drag the start time to 12 PM
 You must create a separate appointment for yourself from 12 PM to 1 PM

query: Q24. What is the fastest way to find a message sent by Bonnie Bradford that includes an attachment?
options:
Search based on sender then filter by Has Attachments
 Search for "has:attachments" and then filter by Bonnie Bradford
 All of these answers
 Enter "Bonnie Bradford attachment" in the search box

query: Q25. Each category must have a unique \_
options:
color
 folder
 name
 name and color

query: Q26. Outlook autocompletes email addresses you have used previously, including addresses that you mistyped. How can you remove an incorrect autocomplete suggestion?
options:
Search the autocomplete library, select the incorrect suggestion, and then click Delete
 Close Outlook, reboot your computer, and restart Outlook
 Wait until the suggestion appears again, then highlight it and press the Delete key
 Delete the corresponding contact

query: Q27. What is the key difference between an appointment and a meeting?
options:
A meeting includes other people
 An appointment is automatically marked as busy while a meeting is marked as tentative
 An appointment can be all day, while a meeting has specific start and end time
 A meeting has specific start and end times

query: Q28. When adding an email account to Outlook, why might you need to enter the server settings manually?
options:
You did not write down your password
 Outlook cannot detect the proper settings for your server automatically
 You do not have an email server
 The server is not on the list of Microsoft approved servers

query: Q29. You are viewing a date three months in the future, in Month view. You switch to check an email in the same window. When you switch back to the calendar, what will Outlook display?
options:
the current month
 the Month view for a date three months in the future
 the current date in Day view
 the current date in Week view

query: Q30. When you @mention a colleague in an email message, what does not happen?
options:
Your colleague's name is highlighted in the message
 The colleague is automatically added to the To line
 @ appears next to the message in your colleague's Inbox
 @ appears next to the email in your Sent items folder (Sent folder in Outlook for Mac)

query: Q32. What is an appropriate use for voting buttons?
options:
Asking your supervisor to prioritize a list of tasks
 Sending customers a three-question survey about a recent service experience
 Asking your colleagues to choose their favorite lunch spot from a list
 All of these answers

query: Q33. You created a meeting for next Tuesday at 2 PM, and several invitees have accepted. How do you change the meeting so it will begin at 1 PM and last for one hour?
code:
A. Open the calendar in Day, Week, or Work Week view. Drag the start time to 1 PM and send an update
B. Double click the meeting to open it, change the start time to 1 PM abd send an update
C. Some people have already accepted, so you must cancel this meeting and create a new meeting
options:
B
 C
 A or B
 A

query: Q34. What permission allows your delegates to read, create, change, and delete items that they create, but not items that you created?
options:
Reader
 Author
 Reviewer
 Editor

query: Q35. Why might you create an additional contacts folder?
options:
To store contacts to share with colleagues
 To avoid exceeding 500 contacts per folder limit
 To make it faster to search for your contacts
 All of these answers

query: Q37. When accepting a meeting invitation, what happens if you click "Do not send a response"?
options:
Outlook will send an email to the meeting organizer on your behalf
 The meeting organizer will not receive an email with your response, and your response will be recorded
 The meeting organizer will not receive an email with your response, and your response will not be recorded
 None of these answers

query: Q38. What happens to your calendar when you adjust the time scale?
options:
You set time constraints for looking events
 You automatically switch to list view
 You change the time zone that your calendar uses
 You change the number of hours visible on the grid

query: Q39. Which is not a good reason to create a new calendar?
options:
To keep track of personal events in a work setting
 To use a shared calendar with colleagues
 To isolate meetings and important dates for a project team
 To have a different view of your calendar

query: Q40. Under what conditions can you successfully recall a message?
options:
Only when the recipient is also using Outlook
 Only if the email is plain text without attachments
 If the email si still in your outbox
 If the email was sent within the past 24 hours

query: Q41. What rule can you create in View Settings to color code messages from a particular senderm such as your manager?
options:
Format Columns
 Conditional Formatting
 Group By
 By Sender

query: Q44. Each \_ can be assigned two default signatures for \_ .
options:
None of these answers
 email account; new messages and replies or forwards
 user; new messages and replies

query: Q49. When you compose and email and click the To or Cc button, where does Outlook search first?

none of these answers
 your People list

query: Q50. What do you call an appointment or meeting that happens on a regular basis?
options:
repeating
 redundant
 related
 recurring

query: Q51. Which key, when held down, allows you to select multiple nonadjacent emails?
options:
Alt (Windows) or Option (Mac)
 Shift+Tab
 Ctrl (Windows) or Command (Mac)
 Shift

query: Q52. You are inviting five members of your executive staff to an offsite retreat. You need to ensure that they do not share the invitation with others. What should you do before sending the email?
options:
Include the text "No Forward" in the Bcc field.
 Turn off the Allow Forwarding option.
 Prefix the email subject with "FWD OFF".
 Turn on the No Forwarding option.

query: Q55. A meeting reminder showed up and you accidently closed it. What is the best way to bring back the reminder when in Calendar view?
options:
Right-click the meeting in the Calendar and select Reminders Window.
 Close and reopen Outlook
 On Windows, on the Home tab, click Schedule View. On Mac, click View > Switch to Other.
 On Windows, on the View tab, click Reminders Window. On Mac, click Windows > Reminders.

query: Q57. What does the ignore button allow you to do?
options:
Flag yourself as unavailable to specific coworkers.
 Route all future emails from a user directly to the Deleted Items folder.
 Skip all misspellings of a specific word.
 Turn off all reminders and notifications.

query: Q59. What happens when you drag an email to the Calendar icon?
options:
The Archive window opens.
 Outlook schedule a reminder.
 Outlook schedule a appointment.
 The Work Week calendar view opens.

query: Q60. In this image, what do you use to move between Mail, Calendar, People and Tasks?
options:
Quick Steps
 Navigation Pane
 Navigation Bar
 To-DO Bar

query: Q61. It is currently the week of April 23. You are viewing the week of May 21 in your Outlook calendar. You switch to email then back to the calendar. Which dates do the calendar display now?
options:
the week of May 21
 the month of April
 the month of May
 the week of April 23

query: Q62. Besides opening an email in a new window, where can you view all the content of a message?
options:
in the sidebar
 in the Information Viewer
 in Message Preview
 in the Reading Pane

query: Q63. You want to print full-page slides to fill 8.5-by-11-inch paper, but they appear too small in the preview. What is the best way to rectify this?
options:
Repeatedly bumo up the scale setting print option until it fills the page in the preview.
 Change the slide size to standard.
 Change the scale setting option to 100%.
 Select the Scale to Fit Paper print option.

query: Q64. Which is not a valid search criteria when searching for messages in your inbox?
options:
Words found in the message itself.
 Who sent the email.
 Attachments.
 Where the email was sent from.

query: Q66. You accidentally delete an email from your inbox. How can you retrieve the deleted email?
options:
You cannot retrieve a deleted email.
 Open the Deleted Items folder.
 Open your computer's Recycle Bin (Windows) or Trash (Mac).
 Click the Undo button.

query: Q67. You are viewing your calendar in Work Week view and see a thin horizontal line running across all days at the 2:30 p.m. position. What does this tell you?
options:
Your next appointment is at 2:30 p.m.

 Your calendar is free from 2:30 p.m. on.
 The current time is 2:30 p.m.

query: Q68. You have a message in your Inbox that has a blue down arrow. What does it mean?
options:
The message needs to finish downloading.
 The sender set the message priority to Low Priority.
 A rule forwarded the message.
 The sender is not in your address list.

query: Q69. Which Outlook function allows you to filter your emails?
options:
Find
 Move
 Tag
 Quick Steps

query: Q76. To keep your Inbox folders organized and lean, where should you move old messages?
options:
a subfolder
 a compressed file
 a file system folder
 an archive

query: Q77. What happens when you delete a folder that contains emails in Outlook?
options:
The folder is emptied and then moved to Deleted Items.
 You cannot delete a folder until its contents are deleted first.
 The contents are moved to Deleted Items, and then the empty folder is moved to Deleted Items.
 The folder and its contents are moved to Deleted Items at the same time.
